arm_group.description: Patients receiving .9% sodium choride for resuscitation

brief_summary.textblock:
This observational study evaluates the impact of high and low chloride containing IV fluids
      on administrative and clinical outcomes. The study uses a large electronic health dataset
      and examines patients receiving fluid replacement and resuscitation. The hypothesis is that
      high chloride solutions are associated with adverse outcomes as measured by administrative
      data and by clinical parameters.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of IV Chloride Content on Outcomes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adults meeting SIRS criteria receiving at least 500 mL of fluid replacement on day of
             SIRS.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Receipt of starches or other colloids

study_pop.textblock: adult patients with SIRS needing fluid replacement

clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of High and Low Chloride Containing IV Fluid Solutions in Patients Undergoing Major Surgery and/or ICU Admission

primary_outcome.description: Inpatient mortality. Expected Length of inpatient stay is approximately 7 days
primary_outcome.time_frame: Hospitalization, Expected Length of inpatient stay is approximately 7 days
